Sentence: One day she (Tara) hears that Ashley is engaged to Melanie Hamilton, his (Hamilton) frail, plain cousin from Atlanta

He (Scarlett) tells her (Ashley) that he (Scarlett) does love her (Ashley) but that he (Scarlett) is marrying Melanie because she (Ashley) is similar to him (Scarlett), whereas he (Scarlett) and Scarlett are very different
She (Melanie) spitefully agrees to marry him (Scarlett), hoping to hurt Ashley
She (Ashley) makes a long trip to Atlanta to stay with Melanie and Melanie's aunt, Pittypat
Scarlett and Melanie fear for Ashley's safety
Scarlett desperately wants to return home to Tara, but she (Tara) has promised Ashley she (Ashley) will stay with the pregnant Melanie, who could give birth at any time
There, she (Tara) persuades Ashley and Melanie to move to Atlanta and accept a share in her (Ashley) lumber business
Melanie makes Scarlett promise to look after Ashley and Beau
Scarlett realizes that she (Ashley) loves and depends on Melanie and that Ashley has been only a fantasy for her (Ashley)
